title: New DIA director to be paid $375K
text:
Salvador Salort-Pons, the new director of the Detroit Institute of Arts starts in the job Thursday. (Photo: Robin Buckson / The Detroit News) 
CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE The new director of the Detroit Institute of Arts will begin his tenure Thursday under a five-year contract with a salary of $375,000, with graduated increases over time.
Salvador Salort-Pons will take over as the museum’s 11th director. He is the former DIA curator of European art and executive director of collection strategies and information.
His contract calls for a total base salary of $475,000 in the fifth year of his contract in 2020.
DIA officials said Salort-Pons “is eager to begin working on his top priorities, which include meeting with DIA staff, hiring a curator of contemporary art and securing financial stability for the museum.”
His first week will also be filled with activities leading up to Sunday’s opening of the special exhibition “30 Americans.”
“I am honored and very excited to begin my tenure as director of the DIA,” Salort-Pons said. “There are many opportunities for engagement with our various communities, and I am dedicated to making an accessible museum where everyone feels comfortable and can enjoy a friendly and memorable experience. I do see our DIA as a unifying place for all.”
DIA Chairman of the Board, Eugene A. Gargaro, Jr., said, “These are very exciting times for Detroit and Michigan and we fully expect that under Salvador’s leadership our museum will continue to expand its community outreach and further enhance its acclaimed visitor-friendly experience.”
JChambers@detroitnews.com
